Except for the rare episodes of urban Yellow Fever (YF) transmission, human infections in the Americas have been acquired from the sylvatic cycle maintained between arboreal mosquitoes and non-human primates (NHPs).
1 Forests of northern South America have been regarded as a key territory for the maintenance and emergence of YF virus (YFV) lineages.

3 In Brazil, the YFV is enzootic/endemic in the Amazon Region, which is in the north from where, it sometimes expands towards the central-west, south (S), and south-eastern (SE) regions, causing isolated epizootic events and human infections to severe epidemics of sylvatic origin.
